translation: zadzior (też: docinek) [the sharp part of a fish hook or arrow that makes it difficult to remove from something caught on it; a remark that is funny but unkind]
sentence: He got a barb stuck in his foot. I tried to ignore their barbs about my new jacket.

translation: padlina [the body of a dead animal, especially a large one that is soon to be cut up as meat or eaten by wild animals]
sentence: Vultures flew around in the sky waiting to pick at the rotting carcass of the deer.

translation: opustoszały [(of a place) with no people in it]
sentence: These resort towns are largely deserted in winter.

translation: szpiegostwo [the discovering of secrets, especially political or military information of another country or the industrial information of a business]
sentence: Three people were also accused of engaging in espionage against a rival firm.

translation: dźwigać [to move something heavy using a lot of effort]
sentence: He heaved the bag onto his shoulder.

translation: skazany na dożywocie [informal; someone who has been punished by being put in prison for a very long time or until they die]
gadatliwy [formal; having the habit of talking a lot]
sentence: He sipped it with relish and soon became somewhat loquacious.

translation: skrucha [the fact of showing that you are very sorry for something bad you have done in the past, and wish that you had not done it]
sentence: This was an extremely violent crime, for which the boy showed no repentance.

translation: burczeć, dudnić [to make a continuous low sound]
sentence: Please excuse my stomach rumbling - I haven't eaten all day.

translation: iskra [a very small piece of fire that flies out from something that is burning, or one that is made by rubbing two hard things together, or a flash of light made by electricity]
sentence: Sparks were flying out of the bonfire and blowing everywhere.
